title: Kelly plays down Russian ASAT threat
summary: A senator and former astronaut said he did not expect Russia to perform another test of an antisatellite weapon because of the debris that posed a risk to that country’s own satellites as well as others.

title: U.S. to ramp up spending on classified communications satellites
summary: The U.S. Space Force plans to request nearly $8 billion over the next five years to scale up development of classified communications satellite networks

title: Falcon 9 busier than ever as Starship reviews delayed again
summary: SpaceX had its busiest month yet in April in terms of launches as the company emphasizes the value of a high flight rate.

title: Emirati astronaut to fly long-duration space station mission
summary: The United Arab Emirates will fly an astronaut on a long-duration mission to the International Space Station through an agreement with Axiom Space.

title: First Dream Chaser vehicle takes shape
summary: Sierra Space says it is making good progress on its first Dream Chaser spaceplane as the company looks ahead to versions of the vehicle that can carry crews and perform national security missions.
